pros: the people, the mission, the artists
cons: unclear alignment across teams makes it difficult to clearly rally around priorities

job_title: Residential Services Coordinator in Toronto, ON
pros: Amazing co-workers, meaningful work, gained a lot of experience
cons: Long hours, no where to grow, not compensated enough, false promises about growth, overworked, not supported properly

review_title: Senior leadership talks-the-talk but doesn’t walk-the-walk
pros: The head office space is brand new, it has great views, is easily accessible via transit and has an artistic design. Most other locations are easily accessible from downtown with a few exceptions. Majority of positions are flexible in regards to working remotely, flexing hours and collecting/using lieu time (depending on department and supervisor). Standard benefits and vacation provided for full-time staff. Most employees are like minded and genuinely care about supporting artists and the arts community. The organization has good intentions and its mission/vision attracts great people.
cons: Instead of addressing real problems, senior leadership is busy writing positive reviews on glassdoor to mask the unfavourable but realistic reviews. Specific promises, regularly involving resources, new support roles, system improvements etc., are broadcast organization wide but follow through is often non-existent, inadequate or counter-productive. There are cases of inequality between employees of similar positions in regards to job expectations, responsibilities, pay and accountability. While staff are asked to voice their concerns and provide suggestions for improvement, it repeatedly feels like thoughtful and realistic solutions are ignored. Most office environments feel tense and unpleasant. Little value is placed on the retention and happiness of staff. Many employees experience quick ‘burnout’ and leave, while others put in the time only to realize that they cannot effect change on the current institutional structure until leadership is revamped.

pros: Working with a wonderfully passionate team that is driven by the mission. Interacting with diverse artists in the space. Being able to work and learn in a beautiful space with lots of natural light. Vacation, personal and health days are a great perk. Benefits are competitive.
cons: Many of the projects seem to be executed in a hurry and without much strategy or research. There is certainly a wealth of knowledge in many employees as well as a database. However, there seems to never be a reference to these resources when they could be of great help. In turn, employees are overloaded and often experience repeat fires that they need to put out. There is a huge information sharing issue, which is tied to the dated technology and software–as well as the lack of org wide communication, training and onboarding. The work culture can become quite toxic with the lack of strategy and vision. Due to the nature of receiving grants and having to meet stakeholder expectations, projects are hardly seen to completion. They are often started, then forgotten when something more pressing comes to the forefront. This creates a huge lack of accomplishment. The blurriness and unstable project goals create confusion around roles as well–this makes it difficult to see career opportunities.

review_title: Claims to support artists but exploits them
pros: there are cool programs going on
cons: overtime work for no pay, demands that keep changing, top-down management that is incredibly white and old and stuck in their ways

review_title: Terrible work environment. Would not recommend to anyone.
pros: There are some wonderful people here as the company brings us in by advertising commendable values and a good mission, but the actual reality of what happens behind-the-scenes is the complete opposite of the values that the company prides themselves on. It's unfortunate that people are being treated the way they are and it's what leads to high turnover here.
cons: Management does not value their employees.  The work environment is extremely unprofessional with employees often taking out their aggression on each other in meetings. Morale is low due to disorganized company structure, lack of vision, and lack of support. Onboarding and training is nonexistent. Management constantly undermines and undervalues the work of their employees (often to the point of harassment), and that is where the root of the problem lies.

pros: Inspiring and unique projects, passionate colleagues, never a dull moment, opportunity to learn about real estate development
cons: There is constant change at Artscape, which results in disorganization, lack of certainty in plans, and mismanagement. For what the organization hopes to achieve, it is vastly under-resourced. Employees have limited capacity for advancement, high potential for burnout; leaders play favourites with staff.

pros: Great mission addressing housing and cultural needs of a growing city. Staff have an innovative problem-solving culture. Willingness to take risks to solve complex problems. Excellent opportunities to see immediate impact of your work.
cons: Like most NPOs, resources are scarce.

review_title: Fantastic organization, dedicated staff and exceptional projects

cons: No room to move up, but lots to grow within role
